Chief Examiner's entry}} It included open-minded [[Durgan (Earth-616)|Durgan the Philosopher]], traditionalist [[Obispo (Earth-616)|Obispo]]{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 1}} and apparently young philosopher [[Tuskar (Earth-616)|Tuskar]] in a minor role.{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 2}} The Council met in a Council Chamber in Scadam.{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 1}} When the pirate armada of warships called [[Black Fleet (Earth-616)|Black Fleet]] approached the planet [[Scadam]], ravaging worlds in their path, the Council gathered to look for a solution.{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 1}} The Scadamites happened to have a pacifist culture, having rejected warfare, weaponry and military generations ago; so the Council refused to take any protective action,{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 1}}{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 2}} instead resigning to their doom.{{r|Secret Wars: Official Guide to the Marvel Multiverse Vol 1 1|; Chief Examiner's entry}} Dissenting, Durgan tried to inspire the Scadamites to fight{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 1}}{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 2}}{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Vol 2 2|; Chief Examiner's entry}}{{r|Marvel Fanfare Vol 1 33}} because they were in an exceptional situation;{{r|Marvel Fanfare Vol 1 33}} but he was found to be heretic and expelled from the council.{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 1}}{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 2}}{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Vol 2 2|; Chief Examiner's entry}}{{r|Marvel Fanfare Vol 1 33}} After this, Durgan went underground, the Council no longer aware of his activities (They wouldn't have approved anyway).{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 2}} The Council met again when the Fleet attacked another planet, several parsecs nearer Scadam; and the greatest Scadamite thinkers looked for a solution to their problem, while Obispo insisted in their policy. Tuskar, who had been Durgan's apprentice, decided to look independently for his missing master.{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 2}} While going sleuth, Tuskar entered a forbidden museum; there he videoconferenced with Durgan. Durgan told Tuskar that he had sent an agent, the [[Chief Examiner (Earth-616)|Chief Examiner]], to [[Earth|another planet]] to collect superpowers he was to use in [[Chief Exterminator (Earth-616)|a champion]]. Tuskar found the idea abhorrent and threatened to report to the Council; but Durgan convinced Tuskar to join him instead based on the fact that Tuskar had also broken the Council's rules during his investigation.{{r|Questprobe Vol 1 3}} Scadam was flattened by the Black Fleet attack, its population almost extinguished.{{r|Quasar Vol 1 45}} It is reasonable to assume that the Ruling Council was dismantled. | Equipment = | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = | Trivia = | Links = }}
